sentences.en: I could not wash away the mark of the scorch.
I scorched my dress when I was ironing it.
sentences.cn: 我把自己的连衣裙熨焦了。

sentences.en: If any of the spray goes onto the lawn it will scorch the grass.
sentences.cn: 这种喷雾剂向草坪上轻轻一喷，就会使草枯黄。

sentences.en: Kurt watched the Pelicans fire their jets and scorch the grass.
sentences.cn: 库尔特看着鹈鹕运兵船点火,它们的喷焰把草烧焦.

sentences.en: Make it aleatoric burn, then it can scorch a heart.
sentences.cn: 让它任意燃烧, 那它就会把一颗心烧焦.

sentences.en: That material will scorch easily if it is too near the fire.
sentences.cn: 那种材料如果太靠近火很容易被烤焦.

sentences.en: That none of all the fires shall scorch and shred.
sentences.cn: 保护你不让这一片火焰烧坏了.

sentences.en: The chlorosis develops from light yellow to tan, becoming brown and finally drying to a'scorch ".
sentences.cn: 褪绿部分由淡黄色演变为黄褐色以至褐色,最终变干呈“灼伤状 ”.

sentences.en: The leaves are inclined to scorch in hot sunshine.
sentences.cn: 叶子在酷热的阳光下容易枯黄。

sentences.en: The leaves will scorch if you water them in the sun.
sentences.cn: 在太阳底下浇水，叶子会枯。

sentences.en: The maid scorch the shirt in ironing it.
sentences.cn: 女佣在烫衬衫时把它烫焦了.

sentences.en: The meat is likely to scorch if you leave it cooking too long.
The walls had been blackened and scorched by fire.
This material will scorch easily if it is too near the fire.
sentences.cn: 这种材料如果太靠近炉火很容易烤焦.

sentences.en: To scorch or sear with heat.
sentences.cn: 使烤焦用热能烤焦或烧灼.

sentences.en: Toss it off, don't leave any heeltap, scorch your throat and be happy.
sentences.cn: 一饮而尽, --不要剩底儿 -- 烧焦你的喉咙,要找幸福!

sentences.en: Young drivers often scorch on the street.
sentences.cn: 年轻司机常在大街上开快车.

words.tran_cn: 灼热的；激烈的；讽刺的；过早硫化的
使烧焦；使枯萎（scorch的过去分词）
把…烧焦；严厉批评；切割；过早硫化（scorch的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: a mark made on something where its surface has been burnt
to burn and slightly damage a surface by making it too hot; to be slightly burned by heat

trans.tran_cn: 使（植物）枯萎，把…晒枯，使成焦土，痛骂

trans.tran_en: if you scorch something, or if it scorches, its surface burns slightly and changes colour
